required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Point of Service Diabetes Screening Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: Point of Service Diabetes Screening Evaluation

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the trial is to collect SCOUT DS, random capillary glucose and Hemoglobin A1c measurements from subject 18 years of age or older.

detailed_description.textblock: The objectives of this study are to compare the accuracy of SCOUT versus random capillary glucose and several diabetes risk assessment questionnaires for detection of HbA1C-defined dysglycemia.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional

primary_outcome.measure: To compare the accuracy of SCOUT DS versus random capillary glucose and several diabetes risk assessment questionnaires for detection of HbA1c-defined dysglycemia.

study_pop.textblock: Attendees of Blue Cross Blue Shield Wellness Event

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known to be pregnant (self-reported)
- Receiving dialysis or known renal compromise
- Known to have photosensitivity
- Taking medications that fluoresce
- Have scars, any tattoos, rashes or other disruption/discoloration on the left volar forearm

overall_official.affiliation: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Louisiana

facility.name: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Louisiana
